info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 30 at 3:37PM EDT until August 30 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN STAFFORD...NORTHEASTERN ORANGE...SOUTHEASTERN RAPPAHANNOCK...SOUTHEASTERN FAUQUIER AND CULPEPER COUNTIES... At 337 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Culpeper, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Culpeper, Bealeton, Nokesville, Opal, Remington, Catlett, Calverton, Midland, Catalpa, Elkwood, Stevensburg, Roseville, Brandy Station, Casanova, Jeffersonton, Winston, Heflin, Cardova, Mitchells and Rixeyville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
